result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L. Skattebo

records.addlTxt: Order to withdraw
Status conference on November 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:30 AM Defendant Michael L. Skattebo appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda Marie Skorr appeared by video for Michael L. Skattebo.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests jury trial in the felony file. The defendant will enter a change of plea in the misdemeanor file. Restitution has not been paid. The State's recommendation is for 30 days jail and a civil judgment for restitution. Defendant wishes for counsel to withdraw. 

11:47 A.M. case recalled, appearances remain the same.
Attorney Skorr moves to withdraw as counsel of record. Motion granted. Attorney Skorr and the defendant to contact the Public Defender's office to reappoint counsel in both files. 
Status conference set for November 23, 2022 at 2:30 p.m. via zoom
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:34 PM Defendant Michael L. Skattebo appeared by video, in custody.  
Attorney Amanda Marie Skorr appeared by video for Michael L. Skattebo.  
Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

All parties have received and reviewed the Report of Dr. Grusecki. Neither parties have any objection to the report. The Court finds based on said Report, Defendant is competent to proceed. This matter is scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing on 06/08/2022, at 10:30 a.m., via Zoom. Adj. 3:37 p.m.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely.
Extension Request 971.14(2)
Competency hearing on May 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
In-patient exam for competency supporting documents.

08:44 AM Defendant Michael L. Skattebo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Skorr appeared by video for Michael L. Skattebo.  Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant refused to participate in an outpatient evaluation. Court orders the defendant to undergo an inpatient evaluation. 
Minutes.
Competency hearing on May 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Fax confirmation of order for examination

3:08 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael L. Skattebo appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Jason Farris appearing for  Attorney Amanda Marie Skorr, by video for Michael L. Skattebo. Competency is being raised.  Court orders competency examination.
Competency hearing on April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Competency Examination.
Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Amanda Skorr, through Public Defender.

3:06 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael L. Skattebo appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Luke Harrison appearing with defendant.  Requests adjournment to allow more time to appoint counsel.
Initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

Defendant in custody.   
Initial appearance is reset to 02-21-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defendant more time to appoint counsel.   Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant is to have no contact with R.K.   Bail not furnished.  Defendant refused to sign recognizance bond and is remanded to the county jail.    
Minutes.
Initial appearance on January 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Victim Identification Key.

Re:  Victim, on 12-21-21.   
Initial appearance is set for 03-07-22 at 1:30 p.m.
